intro: Hieracium incisum subsp. ranisavae, commonly known as the Ranisavae Hawkweed, is a rare subspecies native to specific regions in Europe. It is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae, characterized by its yellow composite flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have serrated edges, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
